Body: Doft announced presale of its tokens to its user community in its strive to innovate the inefficient trucking industry. Pre-ICO 2.0 started November 27 on Doft’s official website.  Silicon Valley, December 7th, 2017 – Silicon Valley truck-sharing startup, DOFT (Do Freight Transportation), rescheduled its ICO and launched the Pre-ICO 2.0 offering its tokens with a 40% bonus. Doft is giving out 100% of the company’s total coin supply, meaning that anyone can become an owner of Doftcoins (DFC) and enjoy the benefits of being a part of the transportation community.  The token sale was prolonged and will end on January 1, 2018, 00:00 a.m. UTC. Doft Bounty Campaign is also available for everyone during the whole crowdsale.  The Doftcoin token will be used to access all the services and products provided by the platform. Today Doft accepts only USD when a customer pays for the services. In the nearest future Doftcoins will become a number one payment method within the network.  Another important value of the token is scaling to other countries. Doftcoins will make the expansion process outside the US market much easier.  The total hard cap for the sale is 200,000 ETH (roughly $90 million) for a total supply of 50 million tokens. 90% of the 50 million tokens will be distributed in the Doft ICO except for 10% (5% reserved for Bounties and 5% more reserved for future mining). None of the tokens have been kept in reserve for further raises or distributed to the Doft team.  The current Pre-ICO 2.0 crowdsale will be live until January 1, 2018 with a hard cap of 5,000,000 DFC. The second and final ICO round will be held in the early 2018.  The funds raised during the whole crowdsale period will be used for the technological improvement, business development and market expansion in the world’s 10 major countries.  When we imagine a new logistics’ era, we think of a free to use, simple, user-friendly solution suitable for every type of business which is involved in the logistics chain. No doubt, the solution should make business processes much easier and quicker, yet without breaking the habits of industry professionals who do the job every day. Doft’s solution is equally suitable for all the parties involved into the transportation chain. Whether you are a carrier, a broker, a trucker or a dispatcher, you’ll find potency as Doft covers all necessary vertical services in transportation.  About – Doft  Doft – a Silicon Valley based startup – developed a mobile app for the trucking industry that provides freight matching services. The on-demand instant freight and truck matching application has been labelled the “Uber of trucking.” Doft aims to improve the lives of truckers and provide ever-increasing value to shippers and carriers through its peer-to-peer service.  Doft is changing the way American truckers and shippers work together, and now taking it further with a Doft ICO crowdfunding campaign, allowing Doft’s users to be part of the project by contributing and receiving Doftcoins, which can later be used within Doft to pay for services and goods in Doft App and Doft Store where Doft sells trucking related products. Body: Imagine the world, where the trucking is as effective as it can be. The truckers’ losses are minimal and the revenue is high. There are no (or little) dead head miles. The payments are done almost immediate and commission free. The waiting at the loading and unloading docs is minimal.   Can you imagine this world?   Doft does can!   Doft is a transportation company that is launching the free platform for the freight shippers and the truck drivers. The Doft algorythm effectively matches the truck driver with the freight that is available in 50 miles radius around him. Doft also offers the back-haul loads, this can help to eliminate dead head mileage. Doft also is working on the mining algorithm. That means that the drivers, who move Doft freight will also earn crypto tokens (doftcoins), which can be spent paying for the Doft Platform premium features and for buying goods in the Doft Store (buy.doft.com)   It is a double win scheme for the driver. He moves freight and gets the money according the load confirmation, and he also gets bonus tokens.   By the way, the doftcoins are available for purchase now https://doft.com/investor-relations     The other side of the Doft platform is the shipper friendly features.   All Doft drivers are pre-screened, are vetted by the Partner service Carrier Checkup. After the vetting and qualifying processes are completed, the daily monitoring activates. If the driver is in your preferred list you will get the notifications of his Authority, Insurance and Safety rating status changes (Premium feature). The shipper will have an opportunity to control the shipment and to get live GPS tracking of the load. The Bill Of Lading or another type P.O.D. is delivered immediately. All the communication is almost paperless (that is for easement of the communication and for saving valuable resources (the trees))   Sure somebody can say, that the model is similar to the one Uber Freight uses. That means that Doft acts like a pure internet service. All the load matching job is done, but no commission is cut. Sure, there will be some Premium features which will be monetized. Still, the main functions will be free for both sides. Doft doesn’t take control over the freight and cashflow, as all these uber-like start-ups do. These startups are acting like a Hi-Tech brokers. But the trucking industry is suffering from the Low paychecks to the drivers. This happens mainly due to the commissions, taken by the middlemen. Every part of the transportation chain can find a benefit of working with Doft. -          The drivers will get the job offers and earn bonuses -          The Direct shippers will find the trucks for less money -          The Freight broker will transfer the info about his freight to the bigger amount of truckers -          The independent dispatcher will find a convenient tool to manage his truck network -          All the parties will have a benefit of Doft drivers being pre-screened, vetted and daily monitored. Title: [ANN] Doft – a new uber of trucking is announcing $50M ICO
Body: Freight-matching startup Doft pitches virtual "Doftcoins" to industry players.  One of the latest entrants into the crowded "Uber for trucking" sector is taking a creative tack to raise funds: selling shares in its own "cryptocurrency," a type of virtual electronic money similar to Bitcoin or Ethereum.  The company, Doft, is a Walnut, Calif.-based tech startup that says its mobile app can reduce deadhead miles, automatically locate backhaul cargo, and help shippers move unplanned urgent freight. The company joins a crowd of recent entries to the freight-matching marketplace that includes Haulme LLC, XYpper Technologies Inc., Transfix, 10-4 Systems Inc., Cargomatic Inc., and UberFreight. To stand out from the pack, the founders of Doft (an acronym for "Do Freight Transportation") are raising money in a way that past generations could not have imagined. The firm held an "initial coin offering" (ICO) in October, in which it created its own currency—called Doftcoins (DFC)—then sold them to buyers like truck drivers, third-party logistics service providers (3PLs), and freight shippers. Launching an ICO allows a firm to seek funding from the general public, rather than dealing strictly with venture capitalists. The strategy works best when large crowds line up to buy shares, so Doft sweetened the deal by offering anyone who bought Doftcoins in October a 50-percent premium on their investment as well as a lifetime of 0-percent commissions—worth an average of $100 per load—on all freight booked through the Doft platform. So the next time you see a tractor-trailer cruising down the highway, remember that the driver behind the wheel may also be a high-flying financial speculator. By DC Velocity Staff

Title: [ANN] Doft – a new uber of trucking is announcing $50M ICO
Body: Cryptocurrency market has been experiencing a huge surge of Initial Coin Offerings (ICO) for the past 6 months, though a lot of experts call it another bubble. Let’s take a closer look at this phenomenon. When Bitcoin first appeared, nobody took it seriously. They said if one had to choose between a hamburger and a Bitcoin, he’d prefer a hamburger.  Today 1 BTC equals $10,000 and keeps on gaining its weight. Following good old Bitcoin success, a lot of other cryptocurrencies appeared. Ether and Litecoin are almost as much popular as BTC and tend to grow rapidly. This positive trend motivates startups to present their own tokens. Initial Coin Offering became an easy way to raise funds for a startup in comparison with a standard crowdfunding campaign or a venture capital investment. VCs rigorously examine your busines plan, roadmaps and graphs, and in the end they always say pretty much the same: “you’re too early for us - show $1M revenue per year and the fund will invest $10M”. Certainly, it’s a prerogative of any venture fund to protect the money it invests, but then again it’s a vicious circle. Any young startup is in need of early financing to go off at a dash in the very beginning. With no early-stage investment any brilliant idea or software takes a risk to fail.  In this case ICO is a great chance to make the wheel spin, because ICO isn’t just the mechanism for new coin issue - it’s the fundraising process for a startup too. And the best part of it is that a startup doesn’t sell its shares at all. Venture capitalists usually take a big part of shares in return of their investment and often interfere in a startup’s development strategy. VCs want fast profitable return of their investments during a short period of time, and for that reason they often push founders of a startup to an exit. The before-mentioned scheme is impossible in ICO. A lot has been said lately about the necessity of cryptomarket regulations, but sure enough there’s nothing more than banks crediting less and venture capitalists getting less investment proposals behind those regulations. If there’s a demand on something, there will always be a supply. It’s a simple rule of economics. Today young startups can hardly break the VCs’ wall, and therefore ICO is a shorter way to the successful fundraising.  Join Doft ICO Pre-Sale 2.0 and get 40% bonus!

Title: [ANN] Doft – a new uber of trucking is announcing $50M ICO
Body: Freight-matching startup Doft pitches virtual "Doftcoins" to industry players.  One of the latest entrants into the crowded "Uber for trucking" sector is taking a creative tack to raise funds: selling shares in its own "cryptocurrency," a type of virtual electronic money similar to Bitcoin or Ethereum.  The company, Doft, is a Walnut, Calif.-based tech startup that says its mobile app can reduce deadhead miles, automatically locate backhaul cargo, and help shippers move unplanned urgent freight. The company joins a crowd of recent entries to the freight-matching marketplace that includes Haulme LLC, XYpper Technologies Inc., Transfix, 10-4 Systems Inc., Cargomatic Inc., and UberFreight. To stand out from the pack, the founders of Doft (an acronym for "Do Freight Transportation") are raising money in a way that past generations could not have imagined. The firm held an "initial coin offering" (ICO) in October, in which it created its own currency—called Doftcoins (DFC)—then sold them to buyers like truck drivers, third-party logistics service providers (3PLs), and freight shippers.  Launching an ICO allows a firm to seek funding from the general public, rather than dealing strictly with venture capitalists. The strategy works best when large crowds line up to buy shares, so Doft sweetened the deal by offering anyone who bought Doftcoins in October a 50-percent premium on their investment as well as a lifetime of 0-percent commissions—worth an average of $100 per load—on all freight booked through the Doft platform.  So the next time you see a tractor-trailer cruising down the highway, remember that the driver behind the wheel may also be a high-flying financial speculator.

Title: [ANN] Doft – a new uber of trucking is announcing $50M ICO
Body: Sometimes I see questions like does Doft need a license of a freight broker.  The answer is no.  Doft is not a broker - Doft is a marketplace.  The difference is that the broker is involved into the cashflow between the shipper and the carrier. He receives the payment from the shipper, cuts his commission and pays the carrier. That is why he needs the license from FMCSA and a surety bond.  Doft is not involved into the cashflow. Doft factors the payments. What does it mean? Usually the shippers and the brokers pay drivers 15 to 60 days after the shipment is done. Some brokers can offer quickpay at an additional fee. Doft makes the payment right after the shipment is completed and the POD is received. Then Doft collects the payment from the shipper. Still Doft doesn't cut the commission. Doft has a fixed service fee.  Broker decides whether to work or not to work with each particular carrier. He does the complete carrier's safety checkup. And if something goes wrong he can be accused in negligent carrier acquisition.  Doft does the complete carrier checkup before any motor carrier is assigned, but it is the shipper who decides whether to work with each particular carrier or not to work.  That is the difference.

Author: zsergey
Title: [ANN] Doft – a new uber of trucking is announcing $50M ICO
Body: Hi guys!  I’d like to share some background of Doft starting from the idea. I hope it will be interesting for you.  The Idea The idea appeared almost 2 years ago. Alia (our co-founder) has friends in Chicago, Illinois. Husband works as a truck driver. And wife is sitting at home with a child. He works as so called ‘owner operator’. It means that he is employed truck driver of the trucking company but in fact he searches for shipment orders by himself and pay % fee to the company. And we discovered that those kind of work requires 2 people. His wife worked at home 4-5 hours a day. She was looking for shipment orders (‘loads’ in trucking), doing paperwork, managing payments etc. You can imagine taxi company with 1 taxi driver and 1 dispatcher - it was the same.  We saw a big opportunity. We wanted to create software product that would instantly match shippers and truck drivers, do all paperwork and finance. In fact we wanted to replace the wife of owner operator - save her time for playing with her daughter and any home affairs.  Preparation We were 3 founders - 2 IT guys with 15 years experience in IT area and 1 PR and Marketing professional. How to start working in trucking - absolutely new industry for us that we know nothing about. As experiment on 1 January 2016 we acquired US Freight Broker license and started operation as old-school trucking broker. Using phone, email and fax we started matching shippers (companies that pay for cargo movement) with motor-carriers (companies that move cargo). It was difficult and tricky at the beginning but after a while we started to move loads pretty successfully. Size of the industry and huge perspectives even more inspired us during that period.  Implementation At the end of the summer 2016 we decided to start creation of our own iPhone App. First version of the product we made by ourselves without employees. We were selected from 6000 perspective projects and invited to Y Combinator. But at that time we had working prototype not presented at AppStore and no customers at all - so we didn’t pass last interview.   At the end of 2016 we released mobile App and started to acquire first customers. At that time we started our PreSeed investment round. Talking to angel investors and VCs we discovered that many of them shared our thoughts. Almost all of them told us the same thing - that revolution in logistics is coming. Similar to revolution in taxi transportation started by Uber. And all that is heating up by self-driving cars researches. We closed preSeed round and started to grow our customers base at the same time improving our product. Now we have Android App and actively working on web-version. Mobile App suits better for small customers like owner operators, small shippers. Web-version is needed to cover medium and large customers like motor carrier companies, brokers, big shippers.  Since we started our project we receive requests from different countries - like Brazil, Mexico, Russia, Canada, China. People are asking us to start the same kind of startup in their countries. We decided that it is too early for us to do that now. We need to take stronger position in US first. But with the help of the universal coins economy, it became possible to develop in this direction much faster. Adding the opportunity to mine our coins while you drive (when mobile App opened and ready to accept orders) we will start to grow our drivers community much and much faster. I believe that we are in the right place at the right time. The trucking industry is very old-school but it is ready for innovations.  Thank you for reading this!  Sergey Zaturanov CTO and Founder of Doft
